instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PP1V8_S4: What is PP1V8_S4? PP1V8_S4 is a 1.8v power rail when the machine is in an S4, suspend to disk state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No cinema.
threads.message:
no image, cpu gets warm no chime . Touchpad vibrates but keyboard light does not come on.  Board are  clean. can't turn on dfu
L7410/20/30 and L3500 0v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R3090</RESISTOR>/98 are ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No cinema.
threads.message:
Don't expect iGPU voltage untill high graphics load is detected.

L3500 should have 5V only when USB device is inserted into corresponding ports.

If <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> goes high, power on sequence has been completed; including CPU core voltage.
The board should be able to enter DFU.
Be sure to follow all the steps from tutorial.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No cinema.
threads.message:
Performs everything according to the instructions and still nothing 
Can I force DFU mode by <SIGNAL>SOC_FORCE_DFU</SIGNAL> up to 1.8v using the <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S4</SIGNAL> line (<RESISTOR>R4035</RESISTOR>) ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No cinema.
threads.message:
Sorry, I just saw you have 00239 board; no DFU there!

You should try known good BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No cinema.
threads.message: Do you have a known good bios ?

I also used the DS-809 but still no change.
